intro: Cryptosepalum, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas and is often found in wetlands and disturbed soils. Cryptosepalum species are typically herbaceous perennials, though some may have woody stems. They play a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and wildlife.
